## <ApiType type="Class" slug="base-provider" symbolName="BaseProvider" /> BaseProvider

Base abstract provider for LLM interactions.

This class defines explicit methods for each type of call, eliminating
the need for complex overloads in provider implementations.

**Bases:**

## <ApiType type="Attribute" slug="m-l-x-model-id" symbolName="MLXModelId" /> MLXModelId

**Type:** <TypeLink type={{"type_str": "TypeAlias", "description": null, "kind": "simple", "symbol_name": "TypeAlias", "doc_url": null}} />

The identifier of the MLX model to be loaded by the MLX client.

An MLX model identifier might be a local path to a model's file, or a huggingface
repository such as:
 - "mlx-community/Qwen3-8B-4bit-DWQ-053125"
 - "mlx-community/gpt-oss-20b-MXFP4-Q8"

For more details, see:
 - https://github.com/ml-explore/mlx-lm/?tab=readme-ov-file#supported-models
 - https://huggingface.co/mlx-community


## <ApiType type="Class" slug="m-l-x-provider" symbolName="MLXProvider" /> MLXProvider

    "name": "thinking",
    "type_info": {
      "type_str": "bool",
      "description": null,
      "kind": "simple",
      "symbol_name": "bool",
      "doc_url": null
    },
    "description": "Configures whether the model should use thinking.\n\nThinking is a process where the model spends additional tokens thinking about the\nprompt before generating a response. You may configure thinking either by passing\na bool to enable or disable it.\n\nIf `params.thinking` is `True`, then thinking and thought summaries will be enabled\n(if supported by the model/provider), with a default budget for thinking tokens.\n\nIf `params.thinking` is `False`, then thinking will be wholly disabled, assuming\nthe model allows this (some models, e.g. `google:gemini-2.5-pro`, do not allow\ndisabling thinking).\n\nIf `params.thinking` is unset (or `None`), then we will use provider-specific default\nbehavior for the chosen model."
  },
  {
    "name": "encode_thoughts_as_text",
    "type_info": {
      "type_str": "bool",
      "description": null,
      "kind": "simple",
      "symbol_name": "bool",
      "doc_url": null
    },
    "description": "Configures whether `Thought` content should be re-encoded as text for model consumption.\n\nIf `True`, then when an `AssistantMessage` contains `Thoughts` and is being passed back\nto an LLM, those `Thoughts` will be encoded as `Text`, so that the assistant can read\nthose thoughts. That ensures the assistant has access to (at least the summarized output of)\nits reasoning process, and contrasts with provider default behaviors which may ignore\nprior thoughts, particularly if tool calls are not involved.\n\nWhen `True`, we will always re-encode Mirascope messages being passed to the provider,\nrather than reusing raw provider response content. This may disable provider-specific\nbehavior like cached reasoning tokens.\n\nIf `False`, then `Thoughts` will not be encoded as text, and whether reasoning context\nis available to the model depends entirely on the provider's behavior. \n\nDefaults to `False` if unset."
  }
]}

## <ApiType type="Function" slug="get_provider_for_model" symbolName="get_provider_for_model" /> get_provider_for_model

Get the provider for a model_id based on the registry.

Uses longest prefix matching to find the most specific provider for the model.
If no explicit registration is found, checks for auto-registration defaults
and automatically registers the provider on first use.

## <ApiType type="Function" slug="register_provider" symbolName="register_provider" /> register_provider

Register a provider with scope(s) in the global registry.

Scopes use prefix matching on model IDs:
- "anthropic/" matches "anthropic/*"
- "anthropic/claude-4-5" matches "anthropic/claude-4-5*"
- "anthropic/claude-4-5-sonnet" matches exactly "anthropic/claude-4-5-sonnet"

When multiple scopes match a model_id, the longest match wins.
